content.meaning: a piece of computer software that does a particular job
content.example: Examples of popular applications include Microsoft Office, Adobe, and Mozilla Firefox.

content.meaning: an electronic, digital device that stores and processes information
content.example: A computer needs to be replaced or upgraded regularly or it will become obsolete.

content.meaning: any device internal to the computer (motherboard, hard disk, ...)
content.example: A hardware geek is constantly upgrading components in his computer to achieve more performance.
The woman hated the look of all the tangled wires behind her desk, which were caused by so many peripherals.

content.meaning: physical things that make up a computer (components, peripherals, ...)
content.example: The company has spent millions of dollars replacing outdated computer hardware.

content.meaning: any program designed to run on a computer
content.example: The geek purchased new software for his computer almost every weekend.

content.meaning: the largest known public network in the world, connecting millions of computers around the world
content.example: Some people refer to the Internet as an information superhighway.

content.meaning: a group of connected computers that share resources
content.example: The company network consisted of 3 servers, 95 workstations, and 10 printers.

content.meaning: information or facts about a particular subject that someone has collected
content.example: It's possible to store a lot more data on a hard disk.

content.meaning: a large amount of data stored in a computer system so that you can find and use it easily
content.example: The company has a database of over 23,000 hotels that allow pets.
